explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: The company's 2024 Annual Report (Form 10-K) details its cybersecurity program, which is aligned with the NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0 and overseen by the CISO and Audit Committee. Additionally, the ColorSnap Match Frequently Asked Questions help page mentions third-party subscription governance and terms, indicating policies for the use of external services.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This SEC filing, the "2024 Annual Report (Form 10-K)," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. It details the company's cybersecurity program, which is aligned with the NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0 and overseen by the CISO and Audit Committee, demonstrating established oversight mechanisms for AI-related risks. The report also mentions the use of an AI-powered app and a data-driven decision-making platform, further highlighting the need for robust governance in their AI implementation.
relevant_sources.title: 2024 Annual Report (Form 10-K)

relevant_sources.summary: The "ColorSnap Match Frequently Asked Questions" help page provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. It supports this by mentioning third-party subscription governance and terms, indicating policies for the use of external services.
relevant_sources.title: ColorSnap Match Frequently Asked Questions

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.findings: The Sherwin-Williams Color Expert App help page explicitly mentions the use of an AI system. It details the AI system's core capabilities, including reading rooms and identifying complementary hues, and explains the methodology behind its recommendation system.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Document AI systems in use, including vendor/third-party AI tools.

relevant_sources.summary: The "Sherwin-Williams Color Expert App" help page provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar. This is because the page explicitly mentions the use of an AI system, details its core capabilities in reading rooms and identifying complementary hues, and explains the methodology behind its recommendation system, thereby offering insight into how the AI operates.
relevant_sources.title: Sherwin-Williams Color Expert App

summary.overall_findings: Sherwin-Williams' 2024 Annual Report (Form 10-K) details the company's cybersecurity program, which is aligned with the NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0, addressing governance at the policy level. This constitutes documented evidence for 1 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars. Drawing from 6 publicly available sources, no qualifying public evidence was found for the majority of the 7 evaluated pillars.
